title: Perkasie station
text:
Perkasie is a defunct <a href="train%20station">train station</a> formerly operated by <a href="SEPTA%20Regional%20Rail">SEPTA Regional Rail</a> in <a href="Perkasie%2C%20Pennsylvania">Perkasie</a>, <a href="Pennsylvania">Pennsylvania</a>, USA. It closed on July 29, 1981 after <a href="SEPTA">SEPTA</a> cancelled its diesel train routes.
The station was formerly operated by the <a href="Reading%20Company">Reading Company</a> and later by <a href="Conrail">Conrail</a> and SEPTA. <a href="East%20Penn%20Railroad">East Penn Railroad</a> operates freight trains on the line between <a href="Lansdale%2C%20Pennsylvania">Lansdale</a>, and beyond. However, active track ends just north of <a href="Quakertown%2C%20Pennsylvania">Quakertown</a>.
The <a href="Perkasie%20Tunnel">Perkasie Tunnel</a> is located near the station.
<a href="Lehigh%20Valley%20Transit">Lehigh Valley Transit</a> interurbans used a separate station at Walnut and Penn, several blocks to the south and east.
